extendedIngredients.name: asparagus
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound asparagus, tough bottoms ends snapped off, tips trimmed and reserved for another use

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and coarsely ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: lemon zest
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon lemon marmellata (er, that's marmalade. If you really can't find any, substitute a pinch of lemon zest)
metaInformation: (er, that's marmalade. If you really can't find any, substitute a pinch of lemon zest)

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, preferably Tuscan

recipes.title: Asparagus and Pecorino Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. You could try CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Make the lemon vinaigrette1. Whisk together the lemon juice, marmellata, and olive oil together in a small bowl. You should have about 3/4 cup. (The vinaigrette can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.)Make the asparagus salad2. Using a handheld mandoline or a vegetable peeler, thinly shave the asparagus, making long diagonal shavings. Transfer to a medium bowl.3. Shave or thinly slice the pecorino and add it to the asparagus. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the lemon vinaigrette, season lightly with salt and pepper, and toss gently. Serve with the remaining vinaigrette on the side.

steps.step: Whisk together the lemon juice, marmellata, and olive oil together in a small bowl. You should have about 3/4 cup. (The vinaigrette can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.)Make the asparagus salad2. Using a handheld mandoline or a vegetable peeler, thinly shave the asparagus, making long diagonal shavings.
Transfer to a medium bowl.3. Shave or thinly slice the pecorino and add it to the asparagus.
Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the lemon vinaigrette, season lightly with salt and pepper, and toss gently.
Serve with the remaining vinaigrette on the side.
